group.pals.android.lib.ui.lockpattern

Class LockPatternActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • Activity
      • group.pals.android.lib.ui.lockpattern.LockPatternActivity

  • public class LockPatternActivity
extends Activity
    Main activity for this library.

    You can deliver result to PendingIntent's and/ or ResultReceiver too. See EXTRA_PENDING_INTENT_OK, EXTRA_PENDING_INTENT_CANCELLED and EXTRA_RESULT_RECEIVER for more details.

    NOTES

    • You must use one of built-in actions when calling this activity. They start with ACTION_*. Otherwise the library might behave strangely (we don't cover those cases).
    • You must use one of the themes that this library supports. They start with R.style.Alp_Theme_*. The reason is the themes contain resources that the library needs.
    • With ACTION_COMPARE_PATTERN, there are 4 possible result codes: Activity#RESULT_OK, Activity#RESULT_CANCELED, RESULT_FAILED and RESULT_FORGOT_PATTERN.
    • With ACTION_VERIFY_CAPTCHA, there are 3 possible result codes: Activity#RESULT_OK, Activity#RESULT_CANCELED, and RESULT_FAILED.
    Since:
    v1.0
    Author:
    Hai Bison

    • Field Detail

      • ACTION_CREATE_PATTERN

        public static final String ACTION_CREATE_PATTERN
        Use this action to create new pattern. You can provide an IEncrypter with Security#setEncrypterClass(android.content.Context, Class) to improve security.

        If the user created a pattern, Activity#RESULT_OK returns with the pattern (EXTRA_PATTERN). Otherwise Activity#RESULT_CANCELED returns.

        Since:
        v2.4 beta
        See Also:
        EXTRA_PENDING_INTENT_OK, EXTRA_PENDING_INTENT_CANCELLED

      • ACTION_COMPARE_PATTERN

        public static final String ACTION_COMPARE_PATTERN
        Use this action to compare pattern. You provide the pattern to be compared with EXTRA_PATTERN.

        If you enabled feature auto-save pattern before (with Security#setAutoSavePattern(android.content.Context, boolean) ), then you don't need EXTRA_PATTERN at this time. But if you use this extra, its priority is higher than the one stored in shared preferences.

        You can use EXTRA_INTENT_ACTIVITY_FORGOT_PATTERN to help your users in case they forgot the patterns.

        If the user passes, Activity#RESULT_OK returns. If not, RESULT_FAILED returns.

        If the user cancels the task, Activity#RESULT_CANCELED returns.

        In any case, there will have extra EXTRA_RETRY_COUNT available in the intent result.

        Since:
        v2.4 beta
        See Also:
        EXTRA_PATTERN, EXTRA_PENDING_INTENT_OK, EXTRA_PENDING_INTENT_CANCELLED, RESULT_FAILED, EXTRA_RETRY_COUNT

      • ACTION_VERIFY_CAPTCHA

        public static final String ACTION_VERIFY_CAPTCHA
        Use this action to let the activity generate a random pattern and ask the user to re-draw it to verify.

        The default length of the auto-generated pattern is 4. You can change it with Display#setCaptchaWiredDots(android.content.Context, int).

        Since:
        v2.7 beta

      • RESULT_FAILED

        public static final int RESULT_FAILED
        If you use ACTION_COMPARE_PATTERN and the user fails to "login" after a number of tries, this activity will finish with this result code.
        See Also:
        ACTION_COMPARE_PATTERN, EXTRA_RETRY_COUNT

      • RESULT_FORGOT_PATTERN

        public static final int RESULT_FORGOT_PATTERN
        If you use ACTION_COMPARE_PATTERN and the user forgot his/ her pattern and decided to ask for your help with recovering the pattern ( EXTRA_INTENT_ACTIVITY_FORGOT_PATTERN), this activity will finish with this result code.
        Since:
        v2.8 beta
        See Also:
        ACTION_COMPARE_PATTERN, EXTRA_RETRY_COUNT, EXTRA_INTENT_ACTIVITY_FORGOT_PATTERN

      • EXTRA_RETRY_COUNT

        public static final String EXTRA_RETRY_COUNT
        For actions ACTION_COMPARE_PATTERN and ACTION_VERIFY_CAPTCHA, this key holds the number of tries that the user attempted to verify the input pattern.

      • EXTRA_THEME

        public static final String EXTRA_THEME
        Sets value of this key to a theme in R.style.Alp_Theme_*. Default is the one you set in your AndroidManifest.xml. Note that theme R.style.Alp_Theme_Light_DarkActionBar is available in API 4+, but it only works in API 14+.
        Since:
        v1.5.3 beta

      • EXTRA_PATTERN

        public static final String EXTRA_PATTERN
        Key to hold the pattern. It must be a char[] array.

        • If you use encrypter, it should be an encrypted array.
        • If you don't use encrypter, it should be the SHA-1 value of the actual pattern. You can generate the value by LockPatternUtils.patternToSha1(List).
        Since:
        v2 beta

      • EXTRA_RESULT_RECEIVER

        public static final String EXTRA_RESULT_RECEIVER
        You can provide an ResultReceiver with this key. The activity will notify your receiver the same result code and intent data as you will receive them in #onActivityResult(int, int, Intent).
        Since:
        v2.4 beta

      • EXTRA_PENDING_INTENT_OK

        public static final String EXTRA_PENDING_INTENT_OK
        Put a PendingIntent into this key. It will be sent before Activity#RESULT_OK will be returning. If you were calling this activity with ACTION_CREATE_PATTERN, key EXTRA_PATTERN will be attached to the original intent which the pending intent holds.

        Notes

        • If you're going to use an activity, you don't need Intent#FLAG_ACTIVITY_NEW_TASK for the intent, since the library will call it inside LockPatternActivity .

      • EXTRA_PENDING_INTENT_CANCELLED

        public static final String EXTRA_PENDING_INTENT_CANCELLED
        Put a PendingIntent into this key. It will be sent before Activity#RESULT_CANCELED will be returning.

        Notes

        • If you're going to use an activity, you don't need Intent#FLAG_ACTIVITY_NEW_TASK for the intent, since the library will call it inside LockPatternActivity .

      • EXTRA_INTENT_ACTIVITY_FORGOT_PATTERN

        public static final String EXTRA_INTENT_ACTIVITY_FORGOT_PATTERN
        You put an Intent of Activity into this extra. The library will show a button "Forgot pattern?" and call your intent later when the user taps it.

        Notes

        • You don't need Intent#FLAG_ACTIVITY_NEW_TASK for the intent, since the library will call it inside LockPatternActivity .
        • LockPatternActivity will finish with RESULT_FORGOT_PATTERN after making a call to start your activity.
        • It is your responsibility to make sure the Intent is good. The library doesn't cover any errors when calling your intent.
        Since:
        v2.8 beta
        See Also:
        ACTION_COMPARE_PATTERN
